results.title: Molly
results.creator_credit: Ned Lander, Hilary Linstead and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Molly is a dog with a special gift- she can sing. This results in fortune and misfortune as it attracts love to the good but noticeable attention to bad fortune hunters. Travelling with her owner (Reg Lye) from the outback to the city brings its fair share of adventures. A modern Australian fairy tale that will delight viewers. Starring Melissa Jaffer, Reg Lye, Garry McDonald, Claudia Carvan and Members of the Flying Fruit Fly Circus.

results.title: Moliere
results.creator_credit: Elvire Chessin, Norbert Tildian and Triangle Productions
results.brief_description: The world and environment of Moliere portrayed in 17th century drawings and paintings. His satirical comedies “Tartuffe”, “Les Ecole des Femmes”, “L’Avarre” and “Le Bourgeois Gentilhomme” are discussed. Several scenes from the plays, spoken in French, are incorporated. The actors are from La Comedie Francaise. Main commentary in English.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elvire Chessin, Norbert Tildian and Triangle Productions

results.title: Molecules in outer space
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Radio astronomers scan the skies with the giant Parkes radio telescope in search of radio signals from molecules. They are looking for evidence pointing to the existence of life in space or to the conditions under which life forms could develop.

results.title: Molecules at work (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Shows that most of the energy that is used by man is derived from chemical re-actions. Illustrates how chemical energy is converted to heat and how the heat is converted into work as efficiently as possible. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: Molecules and life
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Anvil Films
results.brief_description: Outlines achievements in molecular biology which have revolutionised our understanding of the chemical and physical basis of life. Includes the structure of large organic molecules such as insulin, haemoglobin, myoglobin and vitamin B12, the joining together of amino acids, the complexity of proteins, x-ray crystallography, and clinical applications of scientists’ work.

results.title: Molecular motions
results.creator_credit: Hal Geer and National Science Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Uses animation and models to explain how the properties of matter such as fluidity, vaporisation and rate of chemical reactions depend on the types of motion occurring at the molecular level.
